page.title: 04Country Houses.
page.content: Buxted Park House lies to the north_east of Uckfield.Today the mansion is owned by an Arabian prince who rarely visits.It is patrolled by guard dogs.The house and grounds are well maintained by domestic staff and groundsmen who have their own separate living quarters beside the mansion. The house itself is surrounded by acres of woodland,pastureland and lakes.Herds of deer roam freely around the parkland. It is perhaps rather unusual that both these Country Houses are still used for private dwelling,rather than being open to the public, as we find in so many other parts of the country.
